column4: Hi guys, totally newbie to ubuntu (from Gentoo).  How do I see what services are started at startup?
system -> administration -> services
command line.  I'm ssh'aching
man update-rc.d   and checkout sysv-rc-conf
thx jrib
another question.  Where can I (should I!) save my iptables setup so it loads at startup?
!iptables > arturo_on_rails (see the private message from ubotu)
!beryl > Ivis (see the private message from ubotu)
thanks for your help.  update-rc.d only modifies the runlevels.  How can I show?
sysv-rc-conf is a nice ncurses way to do it, otherwise you can ls /etc/rc*.d
and I take that the default runlevel is 6?
2 and 2-5 are identical by default
what you mean?  When I bootup, what is the default runlevel?  in my gentoo is 3
!realplayer > Some_Person (see the private message from ubotu)
it's 2 on ubuntu (and debian)
thanks jrib
type 'runlevel' ;)
:p
!upstart > arturo_on_rails (see the private message from ubotu)
upstart is replacing sysv init btw, so you may be interested in that...
thanks, reading just now...
